review_title: Great company culture not always reflected in smaller depts
pros: Good work-life balance, Nice benefits, Not stressful
cons: Salary levels are low considering the region & respective job titles -- many people have brought this up, but managers always emphasize the room for growth and promotion that will lead to higher salaries. Frankly, while I respected the overall company a lot and felt the *company* culture was great... there can be a big difference between the overall company culture and your department's culture.  It seemed there were a lot of politics in my department and that opportunities for promotion and professional development were largely based on this.  I think the company as a whole is great, would be even better with better salaries and greater professional development investment in their employees.

job_title: At Your Service Agent in Houston, TX
pros: I liked it because coworkers are so nice, but what can you expect working in hospitality? They have a lot of meetings for us where they provide snacks and just fun things for employees like contests. It’s very easy to move up in the company, I was promoted three times in 2 years, hospitality also looks great on your resume. I consider myself an introvert and it really helped me get out of my shell even though some days were hard.
cons: The pay is okay. Compared to other phone operating jobs, $13.25 is fairly low especially for the things we have to put up with. The company claims to be all about treating the employees right but managers will easily override restrictions they shove down our throat just to make a guest with status happy. I’ve told guests no many times only for a manager to cave in and say yes, this makes the guests with status entitled little brats who know they can get what they want if they just ask for a manager and give us a hard enough time. Some of the people at the top seem to have no idea of the challenges that come with hospitality. Hospitality is “the customer is always right” times a billion and it gets hard. I was one of the many employees who was furloughed and while I know hospitality was hit especially hard because of COVID-19, it sucked not knowing where I was going to get my next paycheck or pay. I think they should’ve helped a little with that since they claim to take care of the employees. Also if there’s a manger who makes a lot of money for the company yet is horrible to the employees with the HR reports to prove it, they won’t do anything. All they care about is their pockets.
